description.compact: Invocation matcher which does not care about previous state from earlier invocations.

docblock.description: This abstract class can be implemented by matchers which does not care about state but only the current run-time value of the invocation itself.

description.compact: Registers the invocation $invocation in the object as being invoked.

docblock.description:
This will only occur after matches() returns true which means the current invocation is the correct one.
The matcher can store information from the invocation which can later be checked in verify(), or it can check the values directly and throw and exception if an expectation is not met.
If the matcher is a stub it will also have a return value.
docblock.param: Object containing information on a mocked or stubbed method which was invoked.

description.compact: Checks if the invocation $invocation matches the current rules. If it does the matcher will get the invoked() method called which should check if an expectation is met.

docblock.param: Object containing information on a mocked or stubbed method which was invoked.
